CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1946, pg. 17 reads: "Christmas By Any Name - The orange candels of Havnora the Jewish gift-giving December holiday symbol, will hang holly and electric-lighted Christian Christmas tree at the All Nation Holiday Party to be held by the Shoh Community House of Addison Terrace in Addison Hall tonight (Thursday) at 8:30. Members of the ocmmittee, robed in peasant costumes of European and South American countries, will greet the guests.  A group of the committeee thus attired is shown here.  They are, kneeling: Mrs. Maria Gaglias, Mrs. Anna Hardaway, and Mrs. Evelyn Basnewski, and standing, Mrs. Marjorie Putnam and Mrs. Lillian Landy. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left, kneeling: Maria Gaglias, Anna Hardaway, and Evelyn Basnewski; standing: Marjorie Putnam and Lillian Landy, wearing ethnic clothing, posed on top of table in Addison Hall for All-Nations Holiday party
